body.p: Sponsored by Private Eye and The Guardian and supported by the BJR, the Paul Foot Award, honouring campaigning journalism in the UK, is open for entries.

Submissions will be accepted for material published in a newspaper or magazine in the UK or on a website between November 1 2011 and October 31 2012. No broadcast material is eligible. Individual journalists, teams of journalists or entire publications may enter and entries will be considered for anything from single pieces to entire campaigns.
The award is given in memory of the journalist Paul Foot, who died in 2004.
The overall winner will be awarded £5,000, with the five runners-up each receiving £1,000 at a ceremony in February 2013.
For more details about the award and a 2012 entry form, go to: www.private-eye.co.uk.
Entries must be in by 5pm on November 12 2012. Submissions received after the closing date will not be eligible for entry.
